alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 12:43PM MST until August 09 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 300 PM MST. * At 1240 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Ponderosa Park. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... South Prescott, Ponderosa Park, Indian Hill West Prescott, Downtown Prescott, Oak Knoll Village, Groom Creek Subdivision, Wilhoit, White Spar Campground, Lower Wolf Creek Campground and Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 near mile marker 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 296 and 314. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Bannon Creek, Miller Creek, Sheppard Wash, Willow Creek, Kirkland Creek, Granite Creek, Finch Wash, Hassayampa River, Lynx Creek, Copper Basin Wash, Wolf Creek, Orofino Wash, Board Creek, Skull Valley Wash, Milk Creek and Butte Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
